revised_title: Vibrational Frequencies and Force Field of Benzene
tldr: The authors present a detailed study of the force field, vibration frequencies, and normal coordinates of benzene. They use a quadratic force field with 26 non-zero constants and introduce four dipole moment derivative parameters and ten polarizability parameters to provide satisfactory indications of infra-red absorption intensities and Raman shift intensities. The study aims to reproduce the observed vibration frequencies of benzene and its deuterated derivatives to within 2% using a quadratic force field.
